meanings.definition: Made to look cheap or tacky in a way that is considered inauthentic or lacking in good taste.
meanings.sent1: The kitschified decorations at the party clashed with the elegant theme.
meanings.sent2: The room was kitschified with bright colors and plastic furniture.
meanings.sent3: The kitschified painting of a sad clown made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was so kitschified that it seemed like a costume from a children's show.
meanings.sent5: The kitschified design of the restaurant made it stand out in a quirky way.

meanings.definition: To make something appear gaudy or overly sentimental through the use of clichéd or overly decorative elements.
meanings.sent1: She kitschified her room by adding too many glittery decorations.
meanings.sent2: The artist kitschified the sculpture with excessive glitter and bright colors.
meanings.sent3: He kitschified the gift by wrapping it in shiny, loud paper.
meanings.sent4: The designer kitschified the dress with an abundance of sequins and bows.
meanings.sent5: The decorator kitschified the room by hanging up velvet paintings and neon signs.
